episodeTitle: Say You Want to Live! We Are Your Friends!!
description: Robin concludes her tragic backstory from the Ohara incident. In the present, she expresses her fear of being a burden, but Luffy responds by having Sogeking burn the World Government flag, declaring war on behalf of the Straw Hat Pirates. Moved by this unwavering support, Robin finally cries out that she wants to live.

events.title: Saul's Final Stand Against the Marines
events.description: Vice Admiral Jaguar D. Saul fights against the Marine battleships, defending the scholars of Ohara and attempting to allow young Robin to escape the Buster Call.
events.significance: Demonstrates Saul's sacrifice and conviction in protecting Robin and the knowledge of Ohara, establishing the foundation for Robin's survival and her eventual trust issues.

quotes.text: You'll meet friends someday for sure...you'll come across friends who'll protect you!
quotes.speaker: Jaguar D. Saul
quotes.context: Saul's final words to Robin before his defeat, prophecy of her future with the Straw Hats

events.title: Sakazuki's First Appearance
events.description: Vice Admiral Sakazuki (later known as Admiral Akainu) appears for the first time in silhouette form during the Ohara flashback. He orders the destruction of the evacuation ship, showing his extreme view of absolute justice.
events.significance: First introduction of one of the series' most important antagonists. His ruthless action of destroying a civilian evacuation ship establishes his character and foreshadows his role in future tragedies.

quotes.text: If even one scholar managed to escape on that ship, all our efforts will have been for nothing!
quotes.speaker: Sakazuki
quotes.context: Justifying the destruction of the evacuation ship full of civilians

events.title: Evacuation Ship Destroyed by Sakazuki
events.description: Sakazuki orders the destruction of the evacuation ship from Ohara, killing all the civilians aboard under the suspicion that a scholar might be hiding among them.
events.significance: This traumatic event solidifies Robin's distrust of others and her belief that the world sees her as a monster. It also establishes Sakazuki's extremist philosophy of justice.

events.title: Kuzan Allows Robin to Escape
events.description: Vice Admiral Kuzan (Aokiji), moved by Saul's conviction and disgusted by Sakazuki's actions, helps young Robin escape Ohara on an ice path despite being ordered to capture her.
events.significance: Kuzan's mercy allows Robin to survive and establishes his more nuanced view of justice compared to Sakazuki. This moment has lasting implications for Robin's survival and their future encounters.

quotes.text: Saul was my friend... I'll let you go this time, but if you do anything bad, I'll be the first to catch you.
quotes.speaker: Kuzan
quotes.context: Kuzan's decision to honor Saul's wishes by letting Robin escape

events.title: Robin's Lonely Childhood and Betrayals
events.description: Robin reveals how she survived after Ohara, constantly being betrayed by people who used her for her ability to read Poneglyphs, then turned her in for the bounty on her head.
events.significance: Explains Robin's deep-seated trust issues and why she initially refused to accept the Straw Hats' help. This backstory is crucial for understanding her character arc and the significance of her eventual declaration.

quotes.text: No one in this world wanted me to exist. I was told over and over that I was a demon child.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin explaining her traumatic past to the Straw Hats

events.title: Robin Expresses Her Fear of Being a Burden
events.description: Robin confesses to the Straw Hats that while she considers them friends, she fears that one day they will see her as too much of a burden and abandon her like everyone else in her life.
events.significance: This moment reveals Robin's deepest fear and the emotional barrier preventing her from fully accepting the crew's help. It sets up the need for Luffy's ultimate declaration.

quotes.text: One day you'll realize what a burden I am and leave me behind. That's why I can't stay with you.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin explaining why she believes she must sacrifice herself

events.title: Spandam Points Out the Consequences
events.description: Spandam mockingly points out that protecting Robin means making enemies of the entire world, including the World Government. He believes this will make the Straw Hats reconsider.
events.significance: This statement creates the perfect setup for Luffy's response, highlighting the magnitude of what the crew is willing to do for Robin.

quotes.text: Do you understand what it means to make an enemy of the World Government? It means making the entire world your enemy!
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam trying to intimidate the Straw Hats

events.title: Luffy Orders the World Government Flag to Be Shot
events.description: In response to Spandam's statement, Luffy calmly orders Sogeking to shoot down the World Government flag flying above Enies Lobby, effectively declaring war on the World Government itself.
events.significance: One of the most iconic moments in One Piece. This action demonstrates the crew's absolute commitment to Robin and marks a turning point where the Straw Hats officially become major enemies of the World Government. This single act has repercussions throughout the entire series.

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's order to declare war on the World Government

events.title: Sogeking Burns the World Government Flag
events.description: Sogeking uses his Fire Bird Star to shoot and burn the World Government flag, completing Luffy's declaration of war. The flag burns and falls in dramatic fashion.
events.significance: The physical act of destroying the World Government's symbol cements the declaration of war and shocks everyone present, including the Marines and CP9.

quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking's attack to burn the World Government flag

events.title: Luffy Asks Robin to Say She Wants to Live
events.description: After burning the flag, Luffy directly asks Robin to say that she wants to live, demanding that she voice her true feelings and accept their help.
events.significance: This moment forces Robin to confront her deepest fears and desires. Luffy's direct approach breaks through Robin's emotional barriers and gives her permission to want to live.

quotes.text: Robin! Say you want to live!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy demanding Robin to voice her true wish

events.title: Robin's Declaration: 'I Want to Live!'
events.description: Overcome with emotion, Robin finally breaks down and screams that she wants to live, asking Luffy to take her back to the sea with the crew. This is the emotional climax of the Enies Lobby arc.
events.significance: This is arguably one of the most emotional and important moments in the entire series. Robin finally accepts that she deserves to live and that the Straw Hats truly want her. This moment completes her character arc from someone who wanted to die to someone who embraces life and friendship.

quotes.text: I want to live! Take me out to sea with you!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin's tearful declaration of her wish to live and stay with the Straw Hats

quotes.text: You'll meet friends someday for sure...you'll come across friends who'll protect you!
quotes.speaker: Jaguar D. Saul

quotes.text: If even one scholar managed to escape on that ship, all our efforts will have been for nothing!
quotes.speaker: Sakazuki
quotes.context: Ordering the destruction of the evacuation ship

quotes.context: Warning the Straw Hats about the consequences

quotes.context: Declaring war on the World Government

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Demanding Robin to voice her true wish

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin

themes.description: The episode explores Robin's journey from someone who believed her existence was a crime to someone who embraces life and friendship.
themes.symbolism: The burning of the World Government flag symbolizes the destruction of the oppressive forces that denied Robin's right to exist.

themes.description: The Straw Hats demonstrate that true friendship means accepting someone completely, regardless of the consequences.
themes.symbolism: Declaring war on the world for one person shows the ultimate expression of friendship and loyalty.

themes.description: The episode contrasts the Marines' absolute justice (represented by Sakazuki) with the Straw Hats' personal justice based on friendship and freedom.
themes.symbolism: The World Government flag represents oppressive authority that the Straw Hats reject.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin completes her emotional arc by accepting that she deserves to live and that the Straw Hats truly want her as part of their crew. She overcomes her fear of being abandoned.

characterSpotlights.development: As Sogeking, Usopp performs one of the most important actions in the series by burning the World Government flag.
keyActions: Shoots the World Government flag with Fire Bird Star

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several emotional scenes with Robin and added more reaction shots from various characters to heighten the dramatic impact.
The anime omitted the introduction card revealing Sakazuki would later be known as Admiral Akainu, keeping his identity more mysterious.

trivia.fact: This episode has a 9.6 rating on IMDb, making it one of the highest-rated episodes in the entire One Piece anime series.
This was the last episode to use 'Adventure World' as the ending theme. It was also the last episode to feature any ending theme for 17 years.
This episode was the final episode directed by K≈çnosuke Uda, who had directed the show since the very first episode.
The episode achieved a 13.2% TV rating in Japan, ranking #1 for its time slot.
This episode marks the first appearance of Sakazuki (Akainu), though he appears mostly in silhouette. He would later become one of the most important antagonists in the series.
The scene where Luffy orders the flag to be shot is considered one of the most iconic moments in anime history, frequently appearing in 'top anime moments' lists.
